Match.description: Selects which network interfaces this file applies to. All conditions in this section must match for the configuration to be used. Matching is based on interface properties such as name, type, MAC address, driver, or kernel attributes.

Name.description: The interface name (e.g., eth0). Wildcards (*) are supported.

Network.description: Applies general network configuration to the matching interface. This section controls the overall network behavior, such as bringing the link up, enabling DHCP, DNS, and IP forwarding.

Link.description: Configures low-level link parameters (e.g., MAC address, MTU, Wake-on-LAN). When used in a .link file, it applies to the device regardless of the network configuration. In a .network file, it applies after the device is matched.

MACAddress.description: The new MAC address to assign to the device.

NetDev.description: Defines the properties of the virtual network device being created. This section is required for all .netdev files and specifies the device Name and Kind.

Name.description: The name of the virtual device to be created (e.g., br0, vlan10). length < 16 chars.

Kind.description: The type of virtual device (e.g., bridge, bond, vlan, wireguard).

Address.description: Statically configures an IP address for the interface. Multiple [Address] sections can be used to assign multiple addresses. Can also be configured via valid Address= lines in the [Network] section.
The IP address and prefix length (e.g., 192.168.1.5/24 or 2001:db8::1/64).

Route.description: Statically configures a routing table entry. Use this section to define specific routes, gateways, and metrics. Multiple [Route] sections can be used.

Gateway.description: The gateway address for this route.

DHCPv4.description: Configures the DHCPv4 client behavior. Use this section to tweak how the interface obtains an IPv4 address, including requesting specific options, setting metrics, or using client identifiers.

DHCPv6.description: Configures the DHCPv6 client behavior. Controls how the interface obtains IPv6 addresses and delegation via DHCPv6.

Bridge.description: Configures parameters for Bridge devices. Only applicable if the NetDev Kind is 'bridge'.

VLAN.description: Configures parameters for VLAN devices. Only applicable if the NetDev Kind is 'vlan'.

Bond.description: Configures parameters for Bonding devices. Only applicable if the NetDev Kind is 'bond'.
